Articles.Content:
You just need to build a launcher for a payload

It's great that you got a gaming computer!

And, I don't care how you do your logo, but, if you want an ISSO feel, throw Kerbin in there.

Ok, going with the pixel art, and its looking awesome. So far, no requests for anything, but thats to be expected.
Any assignments?

Any assignments?

Not for you, sorry.
so... no one is working on their assignments? are they waiting for me? Err... why/how am I on break?

Name: RovR Labs

Engineer

All data required, we make everything unmanned!!

Welcome to the ISSO! I am the other engineer, and I design the rockets. It will be interesting to see how this plays out, with 2 different styles of building going together in the same rocket. See you on the thread!

RWSaCP;

RedworkStudios;

RedworkOne.
Dang, thread got quiet...

Hi can I join, apature rocket science has a lot of expereance in collecting data, I have a rocket that fires of probes contains all the science data stuff, my rocket can hold 18 science probes, I think my rocket would greatly help your endeavour.
OK, so what do you want to to do? Be a engineer or pilot?

ISSO Update:

8-16-13 00:27

Alright guys, It's time for Moho! But, I also need someone to volunteer to do the Sun's gravity.

I've landed some probes on Moho, I got them in LKO legit, but I have one huge Interplanetary mission going on so I cheated them into LMO, results:

Probe 1: 02.64m/s^2

Probe 2: 02.62m/s^2

Probe 3: 02.64m/s^2

Probe 4: 02.65m/s^2

Average of 02.64 obvs
I now want to do this legit, with mapsat, can someone make me a moho mapsat probe

ISSO Update:

8-16-13 00:27

Alright guys, It's time for Moho! But, I also need someone to volunteer to do the Sun's gravity.

Ill do the suns gravity! Landed on the sun or low orbiting?

I now want to do this legit, with mapsat, can someone make me a moho mapsat probe

Ill work on a probe

Edit: Hey bio, can I be changed from rocket engineer to satellite engineer? Its more fitting.

Edit Edit: Im assuming its measuring gravity so m using gravity measurement instruments.

Edit x3: I'm going to PM you the probe with pics and the .craft

Edit x4: Cross out edit 2, its a map sat probe, not gravity

Company Name: Sax Man Aeronautics

Engineer or Pilot?: Engineer

Any data you want to contribute: Duna Science Rovers, Laythe/Eve Landers, anything you ask me for.

Guys, I can't get ISA Mapsat to work. D:

I've tried lots of things, but it either crashes to the desktop as soon as I hit "Launch", or the ship explodes after a couple of seconds of flight.

I turn it off during the launch because it slows things down to 1/10 fps, at least. But it works in 0.21...

This is the result of the last night Eve scan.

That is the file. Is it supposed to be so tiny? Do I need more dishes installed? Lower orbit?
